moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c6 4. Nf3 Nf6 5: The starting position for all the games.
moves.9. O-O Bd6 10. Qc2 O-O 11. a3: With both sides castled, the middle game begins now.
moves.11... Nb6 12. b3: Preventing Black's Knight from landing on a 5th rank outpost.
moves.16... Qe7 17. Ne5: I seize a strong square for my Knight.
moves.17... Bxe5 18. Bxe5: If Black wants to exchange pieces while behind in material, I have no problem obliging.
moves.19... a6 20. Rfc1: Must oppose Rooks on the file.
moves.20... Rxc1+ 21. Rxc1: Even better. Now a pair of Rooks are gone and I possess the file.
moves.21... Qg5 22. Bd4: I'm not going to abandon the long diagonal.
moves.22... e5 23. Bc5: Well, now that it's closed, I'll take up residence on an open one.
moves.23... Re8 24. f3: To block the diagonal of Black's B.
moves.25... dxe4 26. Bb1: ...Black's B becomes useless at its current location.
moves.26... Rc8 27. b4: Locking the Q-side Pawns and securing my QB.
moves.27... Qe5 28. Rd1: Switching to the fully open file.
moves.28... Qc3 29. Rd7: The seventh rank, the most dangerous spot for a Rook.
moves.29... Bc6 30. Re7: The more I can tie Black's pieces to defense, the fewer attacking opportunities he'll have.
moves.31... Qxf1+ 32. Kxf1: I'm not sure why he exchanged Queens. The simpler the game, the better from my point of view.
moves.32... h5 33. Bxe4: I win back the Pawn, equalizing that sector of the material.
moves.33... Bxe4 34. Rxe4: Black again exchanges, to my delight.
moves.35... Rxd4 36. exd4: Now I just have to break through.
moves.38... g5 39. g3: Must slow down Black's K side Pawns.
moves.42... f4 43. Bb6: Time to bring on the Bishop.
moves.43... Kc6 44. Bd8: The Black K side Pwans are doomed.
moves.49... Kg6 50. Kd5 Kh7 51. Kc6 Kg6 52. Kb: With the King trapped on the K side, the Black Q side pawns also fall. Black resigns.
